com.simplegeo.client
Class AbstractSimpleGeoClient

java.lang.Object
  com.simplegeo.client.AbstractSimpleGeoClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
SimpleGeoClient
Direct Known Subclasses:
SimpleGeoContextClient, SimpleGeoPlacesClient, SimpleGeoStorageClient
public abstract class AbstractSimpleGeoClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements SimpleGeoClient

Extracts as much common code as possible between the SimpleGeoPlacesClient, SimpleGeoContextClient and SimpleGeoStorageClient.

Author:
Casey Crites

Constructor Detail

AbstractSimpleGeoClient

protected AbstractSimpleGeoClient(java.lang.String baseUrl,
                                  java.lang.String port,
                                  java.lang.String apiVersion)
Main constructor class for setting up the client that the specific Places/Context clients extend from.

Parameters:
baseUrl - String - Default is http://api.simplegeo.com, but this can be overridden
port - String - Default is 80, but this can be overridden
apiVersion - - Default is 1.0, but this can be overridden

enableSSL

public void enableSSL(boolean useSSL)
Set the client to enable or disable the use of SSL for SimpleGeo server requests

Parameters:
useSSL - boolean, true to enable SSL, false to disable SSL

execute

protected java.lang.Object execute(java.lang.String urlString,
                                   SimpleGeoClient.HttpRequestMethod method,
                                   java.lang.String jsonPayload,
                                   SimpleGeoHandler handler)
                            throws org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException,
                                   java.io.IOException
Method for executing HttpRequests synchronously.

Parameters:
urlString - String URL endpoint.
method - SimpleGeoClient.HttpRequestMethod
jsonPayload - String A string with the json that will be sent with the request.
handler - SimpleGeoHandler to call back when the request completes. It will then in turn hand off to an instance of SimpleGeoResponseHandler
Returns:
Either a Feature, FeatureCollection or a regular HashMap.
Throws:
org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException
java.io.IOException
